member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard
member.summary: Model of a Dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.Id
member.summary: ID of the Dashboard. Provided by service at creation time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.Name
member.summary: Name of the Dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.Description
member.summary: Description of the dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.RefreshInterval
member.summary: Interval for client to automatically refresh the dashboard. Expressed in minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.Position
member.summary: Position of the dashboard, within a dashboard group. If unset at creation time, position is decided by the service.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.ETag
member.summary: Server defined version tracking value, used for edit collision detection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.Widgets
member.summary: The set of Widgets on the dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.GroupId
member.summary: ID of the group for a dashboard. For team-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the team associated with the dashboard. For project-scoped dashboards this property is empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.OwnerId
member.summary: ID of the owner for a dashboard. For team-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the team associated with the dashboard. For project-scoped dashboards, this is the unique identifier for the user identity associated with the dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.DashboardScope
member.summary: Entity to which the dashboard is scoped.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.ModifiedDate
member.summary: Dashboard's last modified date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.ModifiedBy
member.summary: Id of the person who modified Dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.LastAccessedDate
member.summary: Dashboard Last Accessed Date.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.GlobalParametersConfig
member.summary: Dashboard Global Parameters Config

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Dashboard.IsNew
member.summary: Describes if the Dashboard is newly created.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroup
member.summary: Describes a list of dashboards associated to an owner. Currently, teams own dashboard groups.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroup.DashboardEntries
member.summary: A list of Dashboards held by the Dashboard Group

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroup.Permission
member.summary: Deprecated: The old permission model describing the level of permissions for the current team. Pre-M125.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroup.TeamDashboardPermission
member.summary: A permissions bit mask describing the security permissions of the current team for dashboards. When this permission is the value None, use GroupMemberPermission. Permissions are evaluated based on the presence of a value other than None, else the GroupMemberPermission will be saved.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroupEntry
member.summary: Dashboard group entry, wrapping around Dashboard (needed?)

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.GroupMemberPermission
member.summary: None - Team member cannot edit dashboard Edit - Team member can add, configure and delete widgets Manage - Team member can add, reorder, delete dashboards Manage Permissions - Team member can manage membership of other members to perform group operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardGroupEntryResponse
member.summary: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing DashboardGroupEntry

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetResponse
member.summary: Response from RestAPI when saving and editing Widget

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardScope
member.summary: identifies the scope of dashboard storage and permissions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardScope.Collection_User
member.summary: [DEPRECATED] Dashboard is scoped to the collection user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardScope.Project_Team
member.summary: Dashboard is scoped to the team.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.DashboardScope.Project
member.summary: Dashboard is scoped to the project.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetScope
member.summary: data contract required for the widget to function in a webaccess area or page.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.SemanticVersion
member.summary: versioning for an artifact as described at: http://semver.org/, of the form major.minor.patch.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.SemanticVersion.Major
member.summary: Major version when you make incompatible API changes

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.SemanticVersion.Minor
member.summary: Minor version when you add functionality in a backwards-compatible manner

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.SemanticVersion.Patch
member.summary: Patch version when you make backwards-compatible bug fixes

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.SemanticVersion.Default
member.summary: The default semantic version: 1.0.0 (i.e. starting with first major version)

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.TeamDashboardPermission
member.summary: Read - User can see dashboards Create - User can create dashboards Edit - User can add, configure and delete widgets, and edit dashboard settings. Delete - User can delete dashboards Manage Permissions - Team member can manage membership of other members to perform group operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget
member.summary: Widget data

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.AllowedSizes
member.summary: Refers to the allowed sizes for the widget. This gets populated when user wants to configure the widget

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.ArtifactId
member.summary: Refers to unique identifier of a feature artifact. Used for pinning+unpinning a specific artifact.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.Dashboard
member.summary: Optional partial dashboard content, to support exchanging dashboard-level version ETag for widget-level APIs

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.AreSettingsBlockedForUser
member.summary: Read-Only Property from Dashboard Service. Indicates if settings are blocked for the current user.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.metaData
member.summary: The entire metadata payload does not need to serialized and provided as part of the widget contract We expose only whats needed with explicit data members. This provides a slight performance improvement as the metadata payload is bulky.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.Widget.SetMetaData(Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata)
member.summary: Applies metadata about the widget.

member.summary: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget Configuration.

member.summary: Description for each type of Widget Configuration.

member.summary: Deprecated: locally unique identity of this kind of widget configuration.

member.summary: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget Configuration.

member.summary: Contribution target IDs

member.summary: Contribution based information describing Dashboard Widgets.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.TypeId
member.summary: Deprecated: locally unique developer-facing id of this kind of widget. ContributionId provides a globally unique identifier for widget types.

member.summary: Publisher Name of this kind of widget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.Targets
member.summary: Contribution target IDs

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.Name
member.summary: User facing name of the widget type. Each widget must use a unique value here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.CatalogIconUrl
member.summary: Resource for an icon in the widget catalog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.Tags
member.summary: Tags associated with this widget, visible on each widget and filterable.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.Keywords
member.summary: Keywords associated with this widget, non-filterable and invisible

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.LoadingImageUrl
member.summary: Resource for a loading placeholder image on dashboard

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.Description
member.summary: Summary information describing the widget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.IsVisibleFromCatalog
member.summary: Opt-out boolean indicating if the widget is hidden from the catalog. Commonly, this is used to allow developers to disable creation of a deprecated widget. A widget must have a functional default state, or have a configuration experience, in order to be visible from the catalog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.IsEnabled
member.summary:
Widgets can be disabled by the app store.
We'll need to gracefully handle for: - persistence (Allow) - Requests (Tag as disabled, and provide context)

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.CanStoreCrossProjectSettings
member.summary: Advanced widgets can store settings referring across projects Non member users can only access information within the current project. Where this is opted in, and "hasNoCrossProjectReferences" is set true, the framework will selectively permit trusted single project configurations. If active, and hasNoCrossProjectReferences is false or null, widget settings will be cleared.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.ContentUri
member.summary: Uri for the widget content to be loaded from .

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.AllowedSizes
member.summary: Sizes supported by the Widget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.ConfigurationContributionId
member.summary: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.ConfigurationContributionRelativeId
member.summary: The relative id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget custom configuration UI. Null if custom configuration UI is not available.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.ConfigurationRequired
member.summary: Indicates if the widget requires configuration before being added to dashboard.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.DefaultSettings
member.summary: Optional default settings to be copied into widget settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.SupportedScopes
member.summary: Data contract required for the widget to function and to work in its container.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.ContributionId
member.summary: The id of the underlying contribution defining the supplied Widget.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.IsNameConfigurable
member.summary: Opt-out boolean that indicates if the widget supports widget name/title configuration. Widgets ignoring the name should set it to false in the manifest.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.CatalogInfoUrl
member.summary: Opt-in URL string pointing at widget information. Defaults to extension marketplace URL if omitted

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.LightboxOptions
member.summary: Opt-in properties for customizing widget presentation in a "lightbox" dialog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Dashboards.WebApi.WidgetMetadata.AnalyticsServiceRequired
member.summary: Opt-in boolean that indicates if the widget requires the Analytics Service to function. Widgets requiring the analytics service are hidden from the catalog if the Analytics Service is not available.
member.remarks: Even if a widget specifies an invalid size we don't consider it invalid as long as it has at least one valid size.
